communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide an electronic copy of your agency's Policy & Procedures and Complaint Form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: York and Jefferson, daily metrics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the following:

1. Daily attendance rates for SY24 for York High School;
2. Daily attendance rates for SY24 for Jefferson High School;
3. ICT Record List from August 21, 2023 through current for the following schools:

York High School
Jefferson High School

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: San Rafael PD
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation is available on VanessaHolton.com

I am asking for a full and correct FOIA disclosure for #SR-20-07929 from the San Rafael Police Dept., with as unredacted a copy of the report filed by Vanessa Holton as allowed. 

I am also asking for four (4) audio recordings between my cellphone (818) 310-5073 and the San Rafael PD. The two with Officer Bellamy, the one with Lt. Bishop, and the one in January of 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Robinson

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Facilities Assessments, York and Jefferson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the following:

1. Facility assessments for York High School;
2. Facility assessments for Jefferson High School;

Please provide the most recent facilities assessment available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Cal State Assembly
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

As to the records I am asking for, on VanessaHolton.com you will find a link in the header Assembly (https://www.vanessaholton.com/assembly)

I am asking for the full contents of each email for those names listed below. I am only asking for one individual from each email, including all the ensuing back and forth communication.

38. I Spoke with Leah Wilson – Criminal - Assembly Member Ash Kalra
46. Clown and Jokers 1 – Assembly Member Ash Kalra
55. Case Closed – The Coverup Continues – Assembly Member Anthony Rendon
59. Recent Claims of Corruption Assembly Member Anthony Rendon
60. My Last Email - Assembly Member Anthony Rendon
62. New story using Chat AI – Assembly Member Anthony Rendon
64. Openings at the California State Assembly Member Ash Kalra
77. Happy Holidays – Leah Wilson – Assembly Member James Gallagher
78. Chief Spiller – Resign – Assembly Member Mike Gipson

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Robinson

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: UC Berkeley
communications.communication:
Hello,

The UC Office of the President (UCOP) has received your Public Records Act request, below. UCOP does not have these campus records; you would need to submit a request directly to the campus using the contact information here:
https://www.ucop.edu/uc-legal/legal-resources/information-practices/information-practices-coordinators.html

We consider this request closed.

Sincerely,
UCOP Public Records
UC, Office of the President
1111 Franklin St.
Oakland, CA 94607
pra@ucop.edu

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

As to the records I am asking for, on VanessaHolton.com you will find a FOIA drop down with a link to State Bar FOIA. (https://www.vanessaholton.com/state-bar-foia)  

I am asking for the full contents of each email for those ending in a California State Bar email address (@calbar.ca.gov) emails  including any and all the ensuing back and forth communications with whomever the email was forwarded to. 

1. 60. My last Email – Each email ending with @calbar.ca.gov emails
2. 65. Critical Business Records Missing – Each email ending with @calbar.ca.gov emails
3. 66. FOIA Requests Ignored Again! – Each email ending with @calbar.ca.gov emails
4. 67. FOIA Requests Ignored 2 – Each email ending with @calbar.ca.gov emails
5. 68. The Meetings are FAKE! – Each email ending with @calbar.ca.gov emails

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Robinson

title: Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Watchlist Inquiry (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Department of Homeland Security,

I, LaJuana A. Reid, am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552). Specifically, I seek records, documents, and any other information pertaining to myself, LaJuana A. Reid, especially related to watchlisting. My watchlist identification number, as understood, is 9596690-00.

I request a search of all relevant databases and systems maintained by your department, including any lists, indices, or databases related to national security, immigration, and customs enforcement watchlists.

Please include any guidance, policies, or procedures related to the nomination, maintenance, or removal of individuals from such lists, as well as any records regarding my specific inclusion or consideration for inclusion.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50. However, I would like to request a waiver of all fees for this request. Disclosure of this information is in the public interest because it contributes significantly to the understanding of government operations and activities, specifically the criteria and processes for watchlisting individuals.

I look forward to your prompt response within the statutory 20 business day period.

Sincerely,

LaJuana A. Reid

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

LaJuana A. Reid

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50. However, I would like to request a waiver of all fees for this request. Disclosure of this information is in the public interest because it contributes significantly to the understanding of government operations and activities, specifically the criteria and processes for watchlisting individuals.

I look forward to your prompt response within the statutory 20 business day period.

Sincerely,

LaJuana A. Reid

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

LaJuana A. Reid

title: Oklahoma City bombing sketches and wanted posters

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Oklahoma City bombing sketches and wanted posters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all high resolution copies of composite sketches made of any individual(s) suspected in the Oklahoma City bombing on April 19, 1995, including, but not limited to, Timothy James McVeigh and John Doe 2. Also requested are any wanted posters or graphics created for the public or police agencies displaying information on the wanted suspects. A format such as a PDF is preferred, and if not, a high quality PNG, are requested for any responsive documents to this request. Should neither of these be available, any other format that can be accessed and viewed by a common personal computer would be accepted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gerardo Bravo

title: Copy Of My Case File With All Supporting Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Copy Of My Case File With All Supporting Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello - I am requesting a copy of my case file which was submitted via IC3 more than ten years ago. I am 68 years old and I am unemployed an in a dire economic situation. I lost $80,000.00 via a cyber crime given my vulnerabilities. I immediately reported this scam to the FBI via their IC3 website. I never had the courtesy of a single response from the FBI since I filed that case of online theft. Not a single response. It's fairly obvious to me that absolutely nothing was investigated. I now suffer from memory loss and cardio vascular disease. I have identified a private company which is willing to investigate this scam on my behalf. I am not optimistic that I will recover any funds given the elapsed timeframe. However, I need to try. I really thought the FBI will act given the amount of money I lost.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Earl James Gobin

title: Copy Of My Case File With All Supporting Documents

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

State of Delaware 2024 compensation data for all employees.
Please provide the following fields for each employee in the dataset: 

Employee # | Last Name | First Name | Middle Name/Initial | Race | Gender | Agency | Department | Job Title | Compensation (base pay, hourly rate, total pay, etc.) | Overtime | Benefits Pay | Date Hired | Date Terminated | Full-time/Part-time | Location of Work City/State

Note: If not all fields listed above are releasable as public record or available please disregard those individual fields for this request.
I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by either e-mail attachment or FTP Download if available, otherwise sent through mail via CD/DVD. I would appreciate the request to be filled in an accessible format, including but not limited to: CSV, Excel, Microsoft Access database, or other bulk list file type.
The requested data will be made available to the public free of charge and will not be used for commercial solicitation purposes. In the event that fees for personnel time and materials can not be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Tyler King.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rexville Raid May 1, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all files, reports, background information, memos, directives, investigatory materials, communications and any other attachments and relevant materials regarding a search conducted by the FBI at Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11  Bayamon, Puerto Rico 00959 on or about May 1, 2023. This request is for records produced between April 1, 2023 and June 1, 2023. This request also seeks all written and/or electronic communications, including e-mail attachments, sent or received by FBI personnel including one or more of the following key words or phrases: "rexville," "campamento resistencia," "conspiracy to incite a riot"," "inciting a riot," "civil disorders," "black and white Puerto Rican flag," "SA Jeremiah Green," and "flaco."

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Board Chair Emails in February, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Chair, from February 01, 2024 to February 29, 2024.

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Thank you for using NYC.gov.

communications.subject: You have an invoice available :: S327629-022924
communications.communication:
RE:  Public Records Request#: S327629-022924 
 
Dear Chris Martin, 
 
 PAYMENT DUE 
 
The City may be the custodian of at least some of the requested public records and a payment is due to continue processing this request. Please log into the Portland Public Records Request Center to pay these fees. 
 
Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. We will not be working on your request until we receive the payment. 
 
Please log in to the Portland Public Records Request Center (copy and right click this link to open it in your browser) and make a payment on this request. 
 
You may pay by electronic check or credit card by going to "My Public Records Request Center" and select "View My Invoices." Then scroll to find your open invoice and select "Make Payment." Follow the screen prompts to make a payment. 
 
Due to the current state of emergency, most City offices are not staffed. Consequently, if you mail a check it could delay the response time and it is preferable that you use the online payment portal to make an electronic payment. However, if you need to mail a check, please reply to this message and ask for the correct address. Please be sure and provide your Reference Number (S327629-022924) on your check. 
 
Please be advised that pursuant to ORS 192.329(3)(b) and (4)(b), your public records request will be closed if payment is not received within sixty (60) days of this invoice. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
City of Portland Public Records Responder 
 
 
 *Please note that you will need to disable your pop-up blocker on your browser's settings in order to make an online payment.
*Please see this Answer for more information:  A006257-010816 If you are having technical difficulties with the website, please contact the website administrator by phone or email.  (503) 823-6040 or prrhelp@portlandoregon.gov
